title: Healing
verses: Psalm 147:3 (WEB) — “He heals the brokenhearted, and binds up their wounds.”
Jeremiah 17:14 (WEB) — “Heal me, Yahweh, and I will be healed. Save me, and I will be saved; for you are my praise.”
Isaiah 53:5 (WEB) — “He was pierced for our transgressions… and by his wounds we are healed.”
1 Peter 2:24 (WEB) — “He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness. You were healed by his wounds.”
James 5:16 (WEB) — “Confess your sins to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed.”
body: Bring your wounds—physical, emotional, and spiritual—to Christ. He bore our sins in his body on the tree so we might die to sin and live to righteousness; by his wounds we are healed. Ask for prayer, receive care, and walk wisely with those who can help. God may heal instantly or gradually, but he is always near to bind up the brokenhearted. Keep trusting him in the process.
prayer: Lord Jesus, my Healer, bind up my wounds and restore my soul. By Your wounds, bring wholeness to my body and heart. Give me faith to seek help, grace to forgive, and patience to walk Your path to healing. Amen.
